sentence.text: Part of the fun yesterday was when Lander doused the walking hero with a bucket of sea water .
If you are a film star and smoke a particular brand of cigar or douse yourself with an exotic perfume then you would be a prime candidate to appear in adverts endorsing these products .
He got up immediately and fetched the brandy , dousing his coffee with it liberally .
He had a video camera on his shoulder last November , when a mob doused three thieves with petrol and looked on as they burned .

Anna emptied cornflakes out of the packet until her bowl was piled high , sprinkled the pile with sugar and doused it in milk , then sat staring at it while the sugar dissolved and the cornflakes drooped .
Mr Chittenden had already doused himself in a flammable liquid and set himself alight .
The tenders should have stayed behind the cordon of soldiers and doused the crowd from there .
Mr Nellis pulled his friend towards a water supply and doused the fire .
Eline felt as though she had been doused in cold water , she swallowed hard and willed herself to speak naturally .

The girl was doused with petrol and set alight after complaining that she was being subjected to ` Eve-teasing , " the Indian euphemism for sexual harassment , rife in a culture in which dating is unusual .
It takes as long as it does for a dog to douse a tree trunk .
He doused with petrol and inflammable glue 12 tonnes of illegally poached elephant tusks , worth almost Â£2m .
He may be placated , an acceptable tribute being pebbles doused in the blood of six young men , then placed high up in the branches of a tree so the mura-muras may reach them .
